item.title: prolific american film director sidney lumet dies
item.description: sidney lumet, an american film director known for inspiring top-notch performances from actors in a stream of classic films including "12 angry men," "dog day afternoon," "network" and "fail-safe," died on saturday at age 86, his hollywood talent agency said.

item.title: rays sign starting pitcher davis to seven-year deal

item.title: france's sarkozy backs draghi for ecb presidency
item.description: french president nicolas sarkozy threw his weight behind mario draghi's candidacy to head the european central bank on tuesday, giving a major boost to the bank of italy chief's hopes of succeeding jean-claude trichet.

item.description: ratko mladic's transfer begins the final chapter in a nearly 16-year international effort to bring him to account after he was accused of crimes against humanity, war crimes and genocide.
